notes:
Homo erectus. Found in northern Kenya. Latin for 'upright man'. Unlike other lines like Homo habilis that died out, Homo erectus survived and evolved. Most experts believe Homo erectus acquired the knowledge of how to start a fire by rubbing together flintstones. At around the same time language developed. Around 400,000 years ago this hominin became the archaic Homo sapiens. 200,000 years later, Homo erectus had fully developed into Homo sapiens, anatomically the same as us. Homo sapiens sapiens, the modern humans, was fully formed genetically about 100,000 years ago.

Turkana Boy was prepubescent, probably about 12 years old. He stood a metre and a half tall.
